name: Add a Dynamic Inventory on Ansible.txt - Create an inventory
description: This section explains how to create an inventory in Ansible, which is a prerequisite for setting up dynamic inventory configurations. It guides the user to click on the '+' button and select 'Inventory' to navigate to the new inventory page, where they can create a new inventory. This step is essential for managing and organizing the hosts or systems that Ansible will interact with.
use_cases: Managing and organizing hosts or systems for Ansible

name: Add a Dynamic Inventory on Ansible.txt - Add the inventory name
description: This section explains how to add a name for a dynamic inventory in Ansible and associate it with an organization. After providing a name and selecting the organization, the user can proceed to further configure the dynamic inventory. The image illustrates the interface where the user can enter the inventory name and choose the organization.
use_cases: Setting up a dynamic inventory in Ansible
Associating a dynamic inventory with an organization
Configuring a dynamic inventory for further customization
capabilities: Adding a name for a dynamic inventory
Selecting an organization for the dynamic inventory
Enabling further configuration options for the dynamic inventory
Providing a visual interface for managing dynamic inventories

name: Add a Dynamic Inventory on Ansible.txt - Create a new source
description: This section explains the process of creating a new source for populating hosts within a dynamic inventory in Ansible. After creating the inventory, the user needs to switch to the Sources tab and create a new source. This source will be responsible for fetching and adding the hosts to the inventory dynamically.
use_cases: Setting up a dynamic inventory in Ansible
Populating hosts in an inventory from an external source
Automating the process of adding hosts to an Ansible inventory
capabilities: Fetching hosts from an external source
Adding hosts dynamically to an Ansible inventory

name: Add a Dynamic Inventory on Ansible.txt - Configure the new source
description: This section explains how to configure a new dynamic inventory source in Ansible, specifically for Amazon EC2 instances. It outlines the steps to name the source, select the Amazon EC2 plugin, provide AWS credentials, set update and overwrite options, and specify any additional source variables or filters to retrieve the desired EC2 instances.
use_cases: Managing and automating infrastructure on Amazon EC2 instances using Ansible
Dynamically retrieving and updating the inventory of EC2 instances for Ansible playbooks
Filtering and targeting specific EC2 instances based on tags, regions, or other criteria
Integrating Ansible with AWS infrastructure for configuration management and automation tasks
capabilities: Instance filtering based on tags, regions, or other attributes
